p: Benzyl benzoate is used in insect and acari repellents, and for chiggers, ticks and mosquitoes [ 33, 34]. As medicine used to treat scabies and lice [ 35, 36], it has been known for more than 100 years [ 34]. Recent studies have shown that cinnamon oil (containing benzyl benzoate 9.99%) presents insecticidal activity against Tenebrio molitor Linnaeus, 1758 [ 37] and Sitophilus granarius (Linnaeus, 1758) affecting respiratory rates and hindering or reducing insect mobility [ 38].
